alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 23 at 2:15PM MDT until June 23 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR MOST OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Widespread hot, dry, windy and unstable conditions continue today throughout much of central and northern New Mexico. Gusty southwest to west winds combined with several hours of low humidity will continue to create critical fire weather conditions. Several hours of single digit relative humidity combined with breezy west winds will create elevated to locally critical fire weather conditions in the northeast highlands and central highlands tomorrow afternoon and evening. Any fire starts will have the potential to spread rapidly in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), North Central Mountains (Zone 120), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), West Central Mountains (Zone 105), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from noon until 8 PM MDT this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
